alcohol_drinks: How often did you have six or more drinks on one occasion in the past year?
drinks_today_number: How many drinks did you have?
alcohol_rehab: Have you ever been in rehab or counseling for heavy alcohol use?
current_recovery_alcohol: Are you currently in recovery for alcohol use?
recreational_drug_use: How many times in the past YEAR have you used a recreational substance or medication for reasons or in doses other than prescribed?  Recreational substances include methamphetamines (speed, crystal), cannabis (marijuana, pot), inhalants (paint thinner, aerosol, glue), tranquilizers (Valium), barbiturates, cocaine, ecstasy, hallucinogens (LSD, mushrooms), or narcotics (heroin).  More than one
substance_use_recovery: Are you currently in recovery for substance use?
sedatives: Sedatives or tranquilizers (like sleeping pills or Valium)
heroin: Heroin or other opioids, including synthetic opioids like fentanyl
caffeine_intake: How many small (8oz or 230ml) cups of coffee OR shots of espresso OR caffeinated teas do you drink on a typical day?
caffeine_intake_today: How many small (8oz or 230ml) cups of coffee OR shots of espresso OR caffeinated teas have you had TODAY?
hydration: How many small (8oz or 230ml) cups of water do you drink on a typical day?
hydration_today: How many small (8oz or 230ml) cups of water have you had TODAY?
dental_problems: Do you have any dental problems that might affect speech?
dental_tx: Do you currently have any tooth loss, dentures, retainers or braces?
seasonal_allergies: Do you currently have seasonal allergies, cold-like symptoms or other conditions that may affect your voice today?
tired_measure: How tired are you?  0=not tired at all, 10=extremely tired
symptoms: There are some symptoms that can affect your voice. Are you currently experiencing any of these symptoms? Check all that apply.
current_neuro_dx: Do you currently have these conditions or currently experience symptoms as a result of having had these conditions?
specify_current_neuro: Which ones do you currently have?
covid: Have you had COVID recently, or are you currently experiencing the effects of long COVID? (check all that apply)
covid_past: Have you had COVID in the past month?
cpap_conditions: Are you currently using CPAP or supplemental oxygen? (check all that apply)
exposed_environmental_pollution: Have you been exposed to environmental pollution that may affect your breathing or voice?
breathe_today: Are you having difficulty breathing today?
breathe_today_difficulty: Please specify the level of difficulty
cough_today_severity: What is the severity of your cough?
circulatory_conditions: Have you been diagnosed with any of these circulatory or heart conditions by a clinician? (check all that apply)
circulatory_med_history: Some other conditions can affect the sound of your voice. Have you been diagnosed with any of these conditions by a clinician? (check all that apply)
ph_standing: Standing for long periods such as 30 minutes?
ph_take_care: Taking care of your household responsibilities?
ph_learn_task: Learning a new task, for example, learning how to get to a new place?
ph_problem_join: How much of a problem did you have joining in community activities (for example, festivities, religious or other activities) in the same way as anyone else can?
ph_health_problem: How much have you been emotionally affected by your health problems?
ph_concentrating: Concentrating on doing something for ten minutes?
ph_walking: Walking a long distance such as a kilometre [or equivalent]?
ph_dealing_people: Dealing with people you do not know?
physical_health_freq: Overall, in the past 30 days, how many days were these difficulties present?
phys_health_impact: In the past 30 days, for how many days were you totally unable to carry out your usual activities or work because of any health condition?
phys_health_limited: In the past 30 days, not counting the days that you were totally unable, for how many days did you cut back or reduce your usual activities or work because of any health condition?
medications: Do you currently take or use any of these medications or substances? Please check all that apply
other_menstruate_specify: If you selected "other" for menstruate, please specify:
menstrual_cycle_status: Where in your cycle are you? We ask because this may affect your voice.
voice_activity: Do you do one of these jobs or hobbies that requires using your voice for many hours a day? Check all that apply
other_voice_activity: If you selected "other" for voice activity, please specify:
hours_voice_activity: How many hours per day do you do this activity with a loud voice or in a loud environment that requires elevating your voice (for instance, a noisy bar or a noisy classroom)?
reading_aloud: How good do you think you are at reading out loud in [English/Spanish/French], that is reading out loud without making mistakes and understanding what you read at a normal rate?
voice_quality_perception: How would rate your voice quality today from 1-10?  1 is the lowest quality and 10 is the best voice quality
voice_difficult_hear: My voice makes it difficult for people to hear me.
tough_to_understand: People have difficulty understanding me in a noisy room.
voice_restrict_social: My voice difficulties restrict personal and social life.
left_out_convo: I feel left out of conversations because of my voice.
voice_lose_income: My voice problem causes me to lose income.
strain_voice: I feel as though I have to strain to produce voice.
voice_clarity: The clarity of my voice is unpredictable.
voice_handicapped: My voice makes me feel handicapped.
ask_whats_wrong_voice: People ask, "What's wrong with your voice?"
no_interest: Little interest or pleasure in doing things.
trouble_sleeping: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much.
no_energy: Feeling tired or having little energy.
feeling_bad_self: Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down.
trouble_concentrate: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television.
move_speak_slow: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual.
thoughts_death: Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way.
hard_to_work: How difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
nervous_anxious: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge.
cant_control_worry: Not being able to stop or control worrying.
worry_too_much: Worrying too much about different things.
hard_to_sit_still: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still.
afraid_of_things: Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen.
tough_to_work: How difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
describe_the_severity_of_a: Describe the severity of auditory-perceptual attributes of a voice problem  *Overall severity scale (0-100)
lack_of_pleasure: Lack of pleasure (in things you tend to enjoy)
agitated: Agitated (restless, fidgety, pacing, cannot sit still)
irritated: Irritated or angry (towards something or someone)
desire_to_escape: Desire to escape (your thoughts and/or feelings)
little_interest: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
feeling_more_irritated: Feeling more irritated, grouchy, or angry than usual?
sleeping_less: Sleeping less than usual, but still have a lot of energy?
starting_more_projects: Starting lots more projects than usual or doing more risky things than usual?
feeling_nervous: Feeling nervous, anxious, frightened, worried, or on edge?
avoiding_situations: Avoiding situations that make you anxious?
unexplained_aches: Unexplained aches and pains (e.g., head, back, joints, abdomen, legs)?
illness_not_taken_serious: Feeling that your illnesses are not being taken seriously enough?
hearing_things: Hearing things other people couldn't hear, such as voices even when no one was around?
someone_hear_thoughts: Feeling that someone could hear your thoughts, or that you could hear what another person was thinking?
sleep_quality: Problems with sleep that affected your sleep quality over all?
memory_issues: Problems with memory (e.g., learning new information) or with location (e.g., finding your way home)?
unpleasant_thoughts: Unpleasant thoughts, urges, or images that repeatedly enter your mind?
repeat_acts: Feeling driven to perform certain behaviors or mental acts over and over again?
feeling_detached: Feeling detached or distant from yourself, your body, your physical surroundings, or your memories?
no_purpose: Not knowing who you really are or what you want out of life?
isolated: Not feeling close to other people or enjoying your relationships with them?
drinking_more: Drinking at least 4 drinks of any kind of alcohol in a single day?
smoking_more: Smoking any cigarettes, a cigar, or pipe, or using snuff or chewing tobacco?
medication_use: Using any of the following medicines ON YOUR OWN, that is, without a doctor's prescription, in greater amounts or longer than prescribed [e.g., painkillers (like Vicodin), stimulants (like Ritalin or Adderall), sedatives or tranquilizers (like sleeping pills or Valium), or drugs like marijuana, cocaine or crack, club drugs (like ecstasy), hallucinogens (like LSD), heroin, inhalants or solvents (like glue), or methamphetamine (like speed)]?
social_phobia_1: felt moments of sudden terror, fear, or fright in social situations
social_phobia_2: felt anxious, worried, or nervous about social situations
social_phobia_3: had thoughts of being rejected, humiliated, embarrassed, ridiculed, or offending others
social_phobia_4: felt a racing heart, sweaty, trouble breathing, faint, or shaky in social situations
social_phobia_5: felt tense muscles, felt on edge or restless, or had trouble relaxing in social situations
social_phobia_6: avoided, or did not approach or enter, social situations
social_phobia_7: left social situations early or participated only minimally (e.g., said little, avoided eye contact)
social_phobia_8: spent a lot of time preparing what to say or how to act in social situations
social_phobia_9: distracted myself to avoid thinking about social situations
social_phobia_10: needed help to cope with social situations (e.g., alcohol or medications, superstitious objects)
traumatic_event: Please list the traumatic event that you experienced
flashbacks: Having "flashbacks", that is, you suddenly acted or felt as if a stressful experience from the past was happening all over again (for example, you reexperienced parts of a stressful experience by seeing, hearing, smelling, or physically feeling parts of the experience)?
emotionally_upset: Feeling very emotionally upset when something reminded you of a stressful experience?
avoiding_reminders: Trying to avoid thoughts, feelings, or physical sensations that reminded you of a stressful experience?
thinking_stressful_event: Thinking that a stressful event happened because you or someone else (who didn't directly harm you) did something wrong or didn't do everything possible to prevent it, or because of something about you?
neg_emotional_state: Having a very negative emotional state (for example, you were experiencing lots of fear, anger, guilt, shame, or horror) after a stressful experience?
losing_interest: Losing interest in activities you used to enjoy before having a stressful experience?
super_alert: Being "super alert", on guard, or constantly on the lookout for danger?
feeling_jumpy: Feeling jumpy or easily startled when you hear an unexpected noise?
irritable: Being extremely irritable or angry to the point where you yelled at other people, got into fights, or destroyed things?
wrapping_up: How often do you have trouble wrapping up the final details of a project, once the challenging parts have been done?
things_in_order: How often do you have difficulty getting things in order when you have to do a task that requires organization?
remembering_appt: How often do you have problems remembering appointments or obligations?
avoidance: When you have a task that requires a lot of thought, how often do you avoid or delay getting started?
fidget: How often do you fidget or squirm with your hands or feet when you have to sit down for a long time?
overly_active: How often do you feel overly active and compelled to do things, like you were driven by a motor?
careless: How often do you make careless mistakes when you have to work on a boring or difficult project?
difficulty_attention: How often do you have difficulty keeping your attention when you are doing boring or repetitive work?
difficulty_concentrating: How often do you have difficulty concentrating on what people say to you, even when they are speaking to you directly?
misplace: How often do you misplace or have difficulty finding things at home or at work?
distracted: How often are you distracted by activity or noise around you?
remain_seated: How often do you leave your seat in meetings or other situations in which you are expected to remain seated?
restless: How often do you feel restless or fidgety?
difficulty_unwinding: How often do you have difficulty unwinding and relaxing when you have time to yourself?
talking_too_much: How often do you find yourself talking too much when you are in social situations?
finish_other_sent: When you're in a conversation, how often do you find yourself finishing the sentences of the people you are talking to, before they can finish them themselves?
difficulty_waiting: How often do you have difficulty waiting your turn in situations when turn taking is required?
interrupt_others: How often do you interrupt others when they are busy?
di_air_in: I have trouble getting air in.
di_tightness_throat: I feel tightness in my throat when I am having my breathing problem.
di_effort_breathe: It takes more effort to breathe than it used to.
di_weather_changes: Changes in the weather affect my breathing problem.
di_breathing_worse_stress: My breathing gets worse with stress.
di_strain: I have to strain to breathe.
di_exercise: My shortness of breath gets worse with exercise or physical activity.
di_breathing_stresses_me: My breathing problem makes me feel stressed.
di_restrict_personal_social_life: My breathing problem causes me to restrict my personal and social life.

moca_notes:
Steps to download MoCA test results from the DUO app and upload them here:

  1. Export MoCA test results in .pdf format to your Sinai email ID from the MoCA DUO app
  2. Open the pdf, enter the password (Rater's MoCA login password)
  3. Remove the password from the .pdf document and save it as a new document.

    How to remove a password from a .pdf using Adobe Acrobat

    Open the PDF in Adobe Acrobat.
    Go to "File" > "Properties" > "Security".
    Choose "No Security" from the security method drop-down menu (you might need to enter the password).
    Save the document to apply changes.
  4. Upload the scanned pdf to Bridge2AI REDCap field below
